heading: Tuesday Night
text: Partly to mostly cloudy. A rising chance of snow late, with a trace to 2 inches, mainly in the Adirondacks and southern Greens. Lows from zero to 10 above, with northeastern cold hollows 5 to 10 below. Winds becoming light and variable early, then becoming south 5 to 10 mph from the Green Mountains westward.

heading: Wednesday
text: Mostly cloudy, with snow likely in the morning; then chance of afternoon snow showers or a late-day squall; daytime snow accumulation 1 to 3 inches. Highs from the mid 20s to around 30 north, low to mid 30s in the south. Winds becoming south to southeast 5 to 10 mph, gusting to 20 mph in the Champlain Valley.

heading: Wednesday Night
text: Mostly to partly cloudy. Chance of snow showers or a squall, mainly before midnight; another trace to an inch. Lows from the mid teens to around 20, cold spots around 10 above. Winds becoming southwest 5 to 10 mph.
